bibl.title: Letter from James F. Waters to Philip Showalter Hench, December 2, 1941

div1.p: Waters gives Hench further information about Forbes and sends a script of the "Court of Missing Heirs" broadcast that included Forbes.[See 03443024]

div1.head: Letter from James F. Waters to Philip Showalter Hench, December 2, 1941
div1.opener:
The COURT of MISSING HEIRS
RADIO PROGRAM
572 Madison Avenue, New York
December 2, 1941
_____________________________
JAMES F. WATERS · Authors · ALFRED SHEBEL
_____________________________
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench
div1.p:
I have enjoyed reading your illustrated booklet entitled Conquerors
of Yellow Fever and have noted several names of people in your letter
with whom we shall communicate with the thought that Wallace Wellington
Forbes might have had some contact with them in recent years.

Our investigation indicates the fact that Wallace Wellington Forbes
was returned to Cuba and the Philippines and we have communicated with
several people in both countries without reply.

Wallace Wellington Forbes mother's address in Chicago is - Mrs. Alice
Forbes, 5450 Walton Street, Chicago, Illinois, and I know she would
enjoy reading a reprint of your booklet.

We are forwarding to you under separate cover a script of our broadcast
of September 23 and trust you will find it interesting reading. Inasmuch
as it is in radio script form, it plays very beautifully. I shall
appreciate your communicating with me further and I likewise shall keep
in touch with you on all clues as we uncover the whereabouts of Wallace
Wellington Forbes.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours JAMES F. WATERS JFW:lh
The Court of Missing Heirs is not vested with judicial power, and is not a court of law or a part of the judicial system of any
state. Rather it is a dramatization of facts broadcast from coast to coast in an effort to find the heirs to estates unknown to them.--
The sole purpose of this court is to render a public service gratuitously--to enable missing heirs to secure the legacies that are
rightfully theirs. It is not the purpose of the court to give legal advice--and it does not solicit or accept compensation from anyone.
